page.title: 10All Saints' Church, Wytham
page.content: The church of All Saints,dating back to Norman times was rebuilt in 1811, using some of the original stonework. The windows and the arches are Early English work. The date (16 ) on the gate, does not refer to the church. The parish is about 10 miles long. The parishioners mainly come from Wytham village. There is one service on a Sunday, and Sunday school for the children. During the week, there is Mothers' Meeting and choir practice. The Harvest Festival is the most well-attended service. On Mothering Sunday the children bring posies of flowers to the church for their mothers. Last year there were 3 christenings and one funeral, but no weddings. About 20% of the villagers attend church each week. All Saints' Church with its quietly caring vicar suits this rural parish.
